comments.body: you could just use `sys.error` here

I'd rather we don't thread the `InMemoryPackageStore` all the way to the Ledger initialization, but rather we simply initialize the ledger and automatically upload the packages from "the outside" via the regular mechanism. What do you think? Duplicate packages will be "ignored" and the other packages just uploaded.

Not sure about that. This `initialize` method also inserts the provided ACS and ledger entries (generated by the scenario loader) into the database, and conceptually the packages should be added before the ledger entries.

In practice, nothing would happen if we first copied the given ledger entries and ACS upon initialization, and then uploaded the packages later from the outside.
I see. Looking at my postgres-index(er) branch, I see that it won't be a problem. ðŸ‘
That's merely ignoring the error, right? Which means that we actually lose the ledger entry. We probably should rather retry n times and then crash the application?

I am not sure. Why can't the command just fail, and we put the retry responsibility on the client? I tend to shy away from ad-hoc retry logics, because you have to make arbitrary decisions which you might not be entitled to. In this case the commands in-flight have time related constraints for instance, so how long should we retry them?
Another thing is that a Postgres database can be down for a long time. A robust application should survive that and recover when it comes back.
Is the command/transaction actually rejected? This would then trigger another write to the database that would fail, right?

Discussed offline: the postgres transaction will fail and thus be rolled back by `HikariJdbcConnectionProvider`. Since the client will never get a completion or a transaction, it should run into a command timeout and retry the command.

While writing this, I realize that because we are using the contracts produced by the scenario loader, the SQL backend will not persist contracts that have been created *and* archived within a scenario, so it will not be able to produce a valid ledger snapshot before the end of the scenario. I don't think this is an issue, just worth mentioning.
